website_summaries.verdict: This deluxe squirrel feeder offers an unmatched combination of style, durability, and value.
pros: Beautifully constructed from strong, durable red cedar
Contains natural oils that help reduce the risk of cracking, decay, and fungus
Easy to fill so you can provide plenty of food to keep squirrels and other wildlife happy
cons: Plastic front tends to fall apart, even after minimal feeder use

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it and I laughed until my cheeks hurt!
customer_reviews.text: Enormously entertaining! I took out the screw that holds the plastic front down just to let them get the nuts and seeds from underneath and get used to there being food in the feeder. Replaced the screw and boy were they agitated when they couldn't figure out how to get the nuts. They thumped their feet, furiously swished their tails, and hurled squirrel obscenities toward the house. I propped up the lid with a couple of peanuts, and that showed them the light! No more squirrel invective, just happy little "piggies". The bluejays are ticked off now...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I set up two of these and it's been so fun watching them figure out how it works
customer_reviews.text: Finally my birds can get to their bird feeder. I set up two of these and it's been so fun watching them figure out how it works. It took my squirrels a little bit to figure it out but ever since it's been wildliy popular in my backyard
customer_reviews.author: Claire V

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This feeder lasted about 6 weeks, by which time our northern Illinois squirrels destroyed it. They learned quickly how to lift the lid and reach in, even the youngest little guys. I don't know if these squirrels are ultra smart because they also quickly discovered that chewing off most of the wood lid and the top few inches of the plexiglass front makes reaching the food super easy. Now we have very fat lazy squirrels and food that's not protected by the elements, but it doesn't last long with our greedy guys.
customer_reviews.author: NJN919

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love this feeder as much as I love watching them
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels love this feeder as much as I love watching them. I had this same exact kind for at least fifteen years. Eventually they go bad as any wood left long enough in the elements would do. It is fun watching lift the top and climb down into the feeder. This is very easy to screw to a tree or fence post. One night I saw a rat helping himself to dinner. Now we put the seed inside of a can in the feeder and remove it at the day.
customer_reviews.author: buyer25

customer_reviews.title: It came dirty and used.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for myself and really loved it a lot. My daughter's birthday was coming up and since she loves working in her yard I purchased yard/gardening themed items. When she opened up the bag, this feeder had clearly been used before. It was dirty, there was a screw missing. Truly disappointed that a gift would come that way. If you want the real deal, make sure you buy this item from a garden center where they are about $2 less anyways. She decided to keep and use...but I wanted to send it back. Whomever sold this should have been honest about it being a used or returned item.
customer_reviews.author: R. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder - very entertaining if you have a porch camera.  Shop around....
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those "gotcha" items if you're not paying attention. Major online pet retailer has it for half the price, for example. Anyway, I just put it out for the first time and the neighborhood squirrels are already obsessed with it. Seems like only one has figured out how to open so far though. Also, I cut a lunchmeat container (like Gladware) in half and shoved it in the top, so that I could put about 20% the amount of peanuts in it, but still have them near the top. The squirrels are fat enough as it is. :-).
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five stars over
customer_reviews.text: Our squirrel loves this and it's very funny to watch him eat out of it. The top flaps. You hear him eat the large sunflowers and then he takes his nuts to hide them. We are happy and very entertained.
customer_reviews.author: kingspass

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. Doesn’t protect the content from rain
customer_reviews.text: Bad design IMO. The lid doesn’t protect the content of the feed from rain seeping in. As can be seen on the provided photo, there are gaps b/n lid and the wall, not to mention that water can seep through the metal hinge, causing corrosion. To top it off, there are no drainage holes at the bottom, so once water gets in, it would have nowhere to go, causing the content go mushy and moldy. I don’t see this feeder being suitable in climates where precipitation happens. Returning
customer_reviews.author: M. Mostov

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels are fun to watch on it
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on a 4 foot length of 4"x4" wood that is cemented in a 5 gallon bucket, so it is portable for when the yard is mowed. The squirrels are fun to watch on it. The lid needs to have a chain or spring that prevents it from staying open. The squirrels have figured out how to get it to stay open, so rain gets inside and makes the feed soggy and stinky.
customer_reviews.author: S. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Needs mods
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed but too big! The distance from platform to lid is too great so red squirrels cannot pop the lid up. Also the plastic front had an indent - our squirrels soon nibbled that away so they didn't need to lift the lid! So I modified it by cutting the side so the lid has a greater slope & fitted a glass front. Voila! Works perfect
customer_reviews.author: T. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Great wood, poorly and cheaply constructed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different brands the Kaytee and the Pennington. They are identical. Same wood, same dimensions, identical in every way except the Kaytee has holes drilled for mounting and the Pennington doesn’t. Both products are cheaply stapled identically. It wouldn’t take much extra to actually screw the pieces together and add a little glue. Great wood, but cheaply constructed with staples and cheap hinges. Could easily be crafted to last for years and years. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut’s World

customer_reviews.title: This feeder was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This feeder was great while it lasted, which wasn't even a month. I don't know if I can blame the feeder or just the squirrels in our yard but they destroyed it in no time. Even though the squirrels knew to lift the lid to get the food they were also chewing on the side and eventually got through. Now the plastic front can't stay on
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: This model has held up well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about ordering this particular model since some people had written complaints in their reviews. However, it was the same one as I have had two previous times, and so far it is working perfectly. The other two deteriorated over time due to the weather and the squirrels did gnaw some on the lid. On the last one, the lid came apart in pieces and did not cover the food at all, so I had to get a new one. Could not find it in a store, so ordered it online.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne H. Lundy, Author of The Girl from Nip 'n' Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Should be better quality of workmanship!
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm going to like the squirrel feeder but I'm not happy with quality of the feeder I received. The Amish are known for their workmanship but they didn't show it in this feeder. The bottom board of the feeder is cracked all the way through, the lid has grooves in it that aren't supposed to be there and one side board needs to be sanded at the end because of splinters of wood sticking out. If I had seen this one in the store I would have chosen a different one. Looks like a second.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels snapped plastic front in days
customer_reviews.text: This Squirrel feeder didn't last a week. I hung the feeder about 6 feet up on a large oak tree in front of my house. For the first day or two the squirrels seemed to enjoy it and were able to figure out the lid entryway quickly. However, within another couple days the squirrels had chewed through the front wood and snapped the front plastic piece in half, spilling the food everywhere. The item is now completely irreparable and useless, and Amazon informed me that the company has no warranty policy on file. Tried going to the company website too, but they didn't even list a contact number or email address.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this squirrel feeder! We mounted it fairly close to the house and experienced lots of laughter watching our little squirrel figure it out. It only took him 2 days to find out how to lift the lid. Well made by very smart Amish folks in America. Love the cedar. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have a white squirrel in the neighborhood that I wanted to lure into my yard. Mission accomplished! So much fun to watch them! I did screw it into the tree with deck screws and not the little ones that came with the feeder, for extra sturdiness. I thought this might be too deep once the feed runs low, but the squirrels hoist themselves in there to get to the very bottom! The mess they leave behind also attracts birds (I’ve seen robins, cardinals, and blue jays) and little chipmunks that stuff their cheeks and scurry back to their homes with a yummy snack.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a new one of these every 4 to 5 years as the squirrels slowly eat it away (I think it is the young ones each spring, learning how to use it), but is well worth it, as the hours of entertainment are priceless. I have this one outside my work window, it give me a break from the computer to occasionally look out at the antics of the Squirrels. I put in the Black Sunflower seed and they will stay and eat those with the birds cleaning up leftovers on ground.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Squirrels cafe house
customer_reviews.text: We love this cute cafe house for the squirrels and every morning our squirrels are coming to have a snack. It was easy to instal, easy to use. And squirrels did learn it in less than 5 minutes how to open it. Well done, good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice feeder out of the package
customer_reviews.text: Very nice feeder out of the package.....but eventually the squirrels decide to eat through the wood to get to the food inside. On this feeder there is a piece of plastic which holds the food in place and allows you to see how much food is inside. Once the feeder has run out of food or when it becomes low my squirrels decided to chew the wood holding this in place and eliminate this all together, therefore I cannot refill it and is useless. I have had this about three weeks unfortunately. I may have to rethink this and buy something more robust!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should have known better
customer_reviews.text: After three days, the blue jays started pecking at the plastic cover. Then the squirrels' claws started getting at it. Today there were two lovely squirrels eating the cedar. Should have known better and sprung for the metal feeder. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good feeder. My only reservations are that I wish the plastic was a little stronger (a woodpecker put a hole in it) and I wish there was a way to prevent the squirrels from getting the plastic out which is annoying. Overall, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Don F

customer_reviews.title: Fun Feeder
customer_reviews.text: It's so amusing watching the squirrels open the lid reach in grab the corn, sunflower seeds and peanuts I placed in the feeder. This feeder also doesn't let them gobble everything in one sitting. It was barely out there for 1 hour and they knew how to get to the food, no training required. :-) ###### Update it didn't last the squirrels eat through the plex-glass in no time.
customer_reviews.author: L. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: While I love almost everything about this, it needs a method of being able to secure the top
customer_reviews.text: While I love almost everything about this, it needs a method of being able to secure the top. The squirrels literally are standing there eating out of the top, emptying it all over the ground within a single day. Can't afford to keep it full at this rate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels learned very quickly how to get into this to eat and no problems with them chewing anything but the nuts. Super easy to install with two screws. Only downside is some water leaks in during rain. Nothing is molding, but multiple squirrels eat everyday, so wet nuts are gone quickly. I'm ordering another, to keep the squirrels from bickering over whose turn it is to eat! Very fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: SayWhat!

customer_reviews.title: Works for squirrels.
customer_reviews.text: I have a bottle-fed baby squirrel that we are acclimating to the outside. He uses this feeder; but we had to show him how it worked. It does keep food dry and the birds cannot "steal" food from it, since that has been a problem. Usually with open feeders, the birds get all the food before he can get to it. It is a good alternative.
customer_reviews.author: margar

customer_reviews.title: Keeps squirrels out of the bird feeders!
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea-our little squirrel friends love the delicious treats they get from the feeder---they don't even bother to climb the tree and eat at the bird feeders-its fun to see them enjoy the corn,nuts and seeds!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Last forever and loads of fun for watcher
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels and chipmunks love these feeders. I throw extra peanuts on the ground for the crows, jays and other big birds but the squirrels and chips do their best to get as many of those as well. If you ever played 'king of the mountain' as a kid you will enjoy watching the squirrel version.
customer_reviews.author: AncientOne85

customer_reviews.title: High satisfied; just had to change a better screw
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have about 3 squirrels who visit it daily. It's also attracted other animals like the House Sparrows, Crows, and once a Raccoon. my only minor issue with it is that they like to stand on top of the lid and sometimes the top lid will close because of the animals weight. The nail provided is alright; although I ended up using my own to support the lid better
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels and other wood critters love this feeder
customer_reviews.text: The item is sturdy enough for the environment in which it is placed but after two months the lid is starting to fray. All in all, I like the item.
customer_reviews.author: Brian PropstTop Contributor: Soap Making

customer_reviews.title: Okay but smaller than some other brands
customer_reviews.text: Okay. Didn’t have pre drilled hole and smaller than similar designed/priced feeders Purchased few of these over the years but next time make sure one other brands. Other one hold more peanuts. This one is about 1/3 smaller than some other brands
customer_reviews.author: James Bond

customer_reviews.title: Great squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great squirrel feeder. Its built well and is strong. The squirrels seem to like it as they not only feed from outside they like to get in it too. The quality is very good and the hinge is strong so it should put up with the punishment the squirrels are giving it. I am going to get another soon as I am so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 star construction okay fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: it took my squirrels a good 2 days to figure out how to open it, once they figured it out they started to empty it out in a matter of hours digging up my backyard to hide the nuts. i love my backyard squirrels but its not really a good idea to get
customer_reviews.author: Scuba

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. easy to clean and the squirrels love it. Funny to watch them fight over it. one will be at the feeder another will try to get at it and while he being chased away the third takes over the feeder and the circle goes on...
customer_reviews.author: LEW

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Xmas gift for our son’s in-laws. They put it up and immediately the squirrels showed up. I expect they will enjoy squirrel watching for some time to come. .
customer_reviews.author: Gail C.

customer_reviews.title: nice item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used ut in new condition for my husband at Christmas. He had to fix the glass as it was installed upside down with the feeding opening at the top but we are happy with it and so are the squirrels!.
customer_reviews.author: kkinkeylargo

customer_reviews.title: Almost too effective.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for, I even like the sound the door on top makes when the squirrel pulls himself out and the door shuts. The only problem is that it's empty in less than a week because the squirrels (or one in particular anyway) are just all over it constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dale

customer_reviews.title: Needs a new design
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this product, the squirrels ate through the plastic door to get to the peanuts. It holds a lot of peanuts but I think they get frustrated having to open it to get a peanut, so it’s just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They Chew the Window
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this thing, I didn't know it had an easily chewed window. I assume Kaytee wants me to buy new ones. Other than that, it's fine. It should get my squirrels fat and have their defenses down by the time hunting season starts.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy for squirrels to use and inexpensive enough that you can replace it when it gets chewed up. By flipping the plexiglass on the front, the squirrels can get food out the bottom or lift the lid for food. There's a ledge on the bottom so they can sit and eat. Does exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Tripping Wisteria

customer_reviews.title: Works Ok
customer_reviews.text: Great looking feeder! A bit noisy with lid closings during feeding, but a small felt pad fixed that. Biggest problem is plastic window. A scrub jay pecked through it and a replacement was chewed up badly by squirrels. Ended up making a replacement aluminum one at more than the cost of feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: I (will) nailed a cat bell on the door so I'm alerted every time they enter it lol AWESOME IDEA!
customer_reviews.text: 1st one received was damaged (hinges were improperly installed near the staples) however the box is sound and really well build. I (will) nailed a cat bell on the door so I'm alerted every time they enter it lol AWESOME IDEA!!! and you're welcome ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Rã Luv

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend. She was happy with it so I'm glad I bought it for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmykat

customer_reviews.title: Cute little feeder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep my squirrel out of the bird feeders. Didn't take them long to find it and use it. Love watching them get the nuts and sit there and eat them... Made well to last...
customer_reviews.author: maltesemom

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my mother-in-law for Christmas and it is of very good quality construction, so darned cute, and works very good. I wish we would have bought her two of them now. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L & F

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels loved it and learned to open it in a flash
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels loved it and learned to open it in a flash. However our neighbor asked us not to invite the squirrels to our yard as they were coming into hers as well. What can I say. We loved watching them.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: I like how the feeder is made and how easy it is to add the peanuts or whatever. It looks beautiful and very nice wood too! It is very well made!!
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: It's a real nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these before but this one is real heavy duty. The only fault I found is there is only 1 hole at the top to secure it (they give you 2 screws) but none at the bottom. You (I) can't get the glass out to put one in the center. Other than that it's a real nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Billieg

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction.
customer_reviews.text: Love this feeder! It is filled with peanuts waiting my first spring squirrels. Can't wait! It is sturdy and solid. Even with the snow and rain we have had, the contents remained always dry. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Torma

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Squirrels love it! Still hanging almost a year later
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Well made love it!
customer_reviews.text: Not only do the squirrels live it so does our woodpecker! Once they all discovered it they emptied it within a week from the bottom not by lifting the lid.
customer_reviews.author: C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality but Confusing
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is a high quality cedar, but we had some trouble figuring out exactly how to use it. We were concerned that the top could fall and harm a small squirrel. We ended up giving it away for someone else to try.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Not working for our  squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's the product, or my squirrels just aren't smart enough - but they can't figure out how to use it. It's been there for a long time and unless I put the food on the outside of it they don't get it. It remains full of food.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made & the squirrels were on it within an ...
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made & the squirrels were on it within an hour. No trouble for them to figure out how to use it & they're so cute sitting on the little shelf eating .
customer_reviews.author: Ginger M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice feeder, however the front wooden piece was broken ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice feeder, however the front wooden piece was broken before we took it out of the box. The squirrels still like it. It would have been a 5 star if it wasn't broken.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Herron

customer_reviews.title: ... chewed it up so I guess the design isn't super practical.
customer_reviews.text: It's cute but for some reason the squirrels very quickly chewed it up so I guess the design isn't super practical.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: Nailed it to my fence, squirrels love it. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder.
customer_reviews.text: So far, the squirrels haven't used it. It's been about a week so it will take time. Well made item. A squirrel found it today. I put a little of the feed on the ledge, and it him no time to lift the lid and munch away. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: ronald goodin

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels use it every day! It's very durable. This feeder has even held up to the raccoons on it at night too. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: CardioRN

customer_reviews.title: Love it just what I needed to keep the squirrels ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it just what I needed to keep the squirrels away from my other feeders. I put it on my post fence and theyou have a great time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Caouette

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: works well, squirrels manage to open it and get the food out while birds only get to eat whatever the squirrels drop on the ground while feeding. Looks good and so far it lasted a couple of month in tropical weather.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya P.

customer_reviews.title: User approved
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and the tree rats seem satisfied with it. Second one I ordered was just as nice as the first one. Put a hook and eye latch on the side to keep the little munchers from gorging for too long a period.
customer_reviews.author: Bugwar

customer_reviews.title: It is easily assembled and easily screwed to the tree
customer_reviews.text: It is easily assembled and easily screwed to the tree, but the squirrels love to eat the cedar (just so you will know)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels are fast learners.
customer_reviews.text: I left lid open until they noticed feeder. Once they used it a couple of times, I closed the lid. Squirrels are fast learners to get to the peanuts. Entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: nancypants1

customer_reviews.title: smells great, super easy to screw into the fence
customer_reviews.text: smells great, super easy to screw into the fence. hopefully the squirrels use it properly and don't just chew right through it...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Meadows

customer_reviews.title: This is the peanut squirrel feeder to buy.. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the peanut squirrel feeder to buy... the metal ones almost cut their little heads off, they should not sell the metal ones
customer_reviews.author: VINNY

customer_reviews.title: My squirrel friends love it. I did add little round carpet stickies ...
customer_reviews.text: My squirrel friends love it. I did add little round carpet stickies to make it quieter when the lid slams down.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Great squirrel feeder for great price! The squirrels took a couple of days to figure it out but it seems like it will last. Right out of the box it smells kind of gross and overbearing but that's probably just the wood smell and is not a big deal if it's being put outside.
customer_reviews.author: sharie z

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: We are using as a bird feeder, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: figured out how to open the top of this feeder quite easily. Fun to watch them
customer_reviews.text: Well, the thing is-I bought this squirrel feeder to help keep the squirrels out of the bird feeder. Then the racoons raided the squirrel feeder! This being said-the squirrels, when they did get to use their own feeder, figured out how to open the top of this feeder quite easily. Fun to watch them!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: makes my squirrel happy, keeps them out of my bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased several of these, makes my squirrel happy, keeps them out of my bird feeder. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Made well
customer_reviews.text: This one is made good , it is a little smaller then our other one .. we took the little screw out that keeps the glass from being able to be pushed up .. As we have a couple of little ones that can't open the to yet
customer_reviews.author: Mona Ann Norton

customer_reviews.title: The Squirrels ate the Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I like this feeder because I can easily see the volume of food remaining. I dislike it because within a couple weeks the squirrels were able to chew it apart. They ate the corners that held in the clear plastic piece. So it is not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: LakeGirlVA

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is very sturdy and the squirrels have no problem with it. However, it's not all that waterproof. Suitable for nuts in the shell, but shelled nuts have to be replaced after a rain.
customer_reviews.author: RyanD

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels can destroy the feeder
customer_reviews.text: Loved this squirrel feeder but the squirrels literally destroyed it in less than 2 weeks. They chewed up the sides and the plexiglass that holds the food in place and pulled it out. We put it back in but it’s a mess. The feeder is adorable and if you don’t have mutant squirrels, it would probably work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cinda M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach to a tree. Squirrels are already loving the peanuts and seem to have no problem lifting the lid. Unless I'm missing something, would be better if you could slide up the front window to clean out debris seasonally. Seems to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works good but was like oil all over the glass
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Bummer for our slow squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I loved this feeder for a couple days, but soon enough our squirrels shredded apart the entire bottom because they weren't bright enough to understand they have to lift up the top of the feeder. **will not work for all squirrel intelligences
customer_reviews.author: Bi Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels are at this feeder everyday in the morning and evening. It keeps the blue jays from stealing the peanuts I was putting out. I put a twig inside to slightly open the lid of the feeder to help the younger squirrels figure out how do get in to it.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Evans

customer_reviews.title: I have happy squirrels.
customer_reviews.text: The Kaytee Cedar Squirrel feeder is well constructed and my squirrels are very happy campers.
customer_reviews.author: olybev

customer_reviews.title: This feeder works perfect for them
customer_reviews.text: I have two fox squirrels that visit my house everyday. This feeder works perfect for them. It's a great quality, the hinges are easy to open. The feeder holds an ample amount of food.
customer_reviews.author: Barker

customer_reviews.title: ... feeling my back patio and this squirrel feeder is perfect! They love it
customer_reviews.text: There are a few squirrels that I am feeling my back patio and this squirrel feeder is perfect! They love it.
customer_reviews.author: aileenr

customer_reviews.title: The last one lasted 4 years which is good for sun
customer_reviews.text: This the second one I have bought. The last one lasted 4 years which is good for sun, rain, and severe weather. Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.author: MarkA. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels don't like much.
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels do not like this feeding box. There is not much room for them to sit and eat so they get frustrated and try to go after the expensive bird feed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Taz

customer_reviews.title: Fun For The Squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: Our squirrels are having a blast eating out of this feeder! It does get a little brittle in the direct sun and the wood does crack somewhat easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jenkyns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels figured it out the next day and with this they visit the bird feeders less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted. I’m sure my squirrels will be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to see if it would keep the squirrels away from my other feeders. So far it is. And I love watching them use this.
customer_reviews.author: youngamm

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still sitting in my garage after a year....haven't put it up.
customer_reviews.author: Gianna

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and returned both. They are made well but the plastic front is not clear. It was cloudy on both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M.

customer_reviews.title: squirrel feeder bargain
customer_reviews.text: feeder is well made. I feed shelled corn so I made just a few changes. turned the glass upside down so that the corn will drop out of the container. squirrels love it.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL MCCABE

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels ate the cedar as well as the food ...
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels ate the cedar as well as the food inside. I guess you shouldn't make squirrel feeders out of this kind of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Juliette

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Feeder is sturdily made and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Karst

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment for the bushy tails
customer_reviews.text: East to install,and a treat to watch our squirrel families enjoy! I have one that is over 8 yrs old, identical, and it has held up well despite our coastal Carolina climate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dunham

customer_reviews.title: It did not take the squirrels long to fine it and learn how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Very well build. It did not take the squirrels long to fine it and learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Hardie Jefferies

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and product for anyone who loves nature's little creatures!
customer_reviews.author: Spyder

customer_reviews.title: Our squirrels have been visiting this feeder for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Our squirrels have been visiting this feeder for a couple of years now and have not managed to destroy it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Squirrel Feeder
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels love it! When the food level gets low, they actually climb inside to stay safe while eating. It attracts the squirrels and keeps me entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Great high quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality product, well constructed of nice wood. The edges are sanded, no splinters. The plastic is removable with a single screw for cleaning, and the mounting hardware is simple (not hard to get to like other models).
customer_reviews.author: Ajohns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the sweet corn logs and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for using the sweet corn logs. The squirrels can sit and eat.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Riffel

product_meta.title: Kaytee Cedar Squirrel Feeder
product_meta.description: Your Kaytee Cedar Squirrel Wildlife Feeder is made of renewable, durable Red Cedar. Keeps squirrels and other wildlife occupied.
feature_bullets: Natural oils help resist cracking, decay, bacteria and fungus.
Well-constructed, attractive and a great value.
Offer your backyard inhabitants a nutritious meal to keep them coming back
